caption: Best pretzel in town!
Super underrated place. Food is great and going out here is great
Staff is amazing. The ambiance has the feeling of warmth, like a big bear hug,...and if you sit by the fireplace,...real actual fire warmth.
Has not changed in 30 years
Love it! Brunch is great. Support local.
Great place for brunch or a sandwich!

I very much enjoyed the food, but we left a band performance immediately after eating due to the poor service.  I thought the yelp reviews were unreasonably harsh until I experienced it for myself.  An employee hatefully told my colleagues and I to 'zip it' (hand motions included) just as the band started up, although most other patrons were talking and a group behind us were being considerably louder.  We sat stunned and embarrassed, listening to all the loud chatter around us and unsure why we were singled out.  My colleagues and I don't really project when we talk and no one else seemed disturbed, but supposing we were disturbing anyone, I'm unsure why you would not simply ask your customers to be quiet.  I felt like a child being scolded by her parents.  The remaining staff seemed disengaged in their work.  No smiles, no greetings.  It was a very disappointing experience.
Good food, cheap meals, good choice of drinks on tap, good price.
Sometimes could be busy but the food and drink are of high level. I love all of my experiences here!
Great local 👍
Great staff great food
Hairy Bear --> good stuff
I have lived in Bloomington almost 30 years and have never been to Bear's Place. Got to say, our first visit was great and we will be back. Great service, fresh made food, good stuff!
Good booze, good food, lovely staff
The drinks and food prices are ok, and the portions sizes are good. They have a stage in the back and have regular performances.
I love Bear’s. The bartenders are great, and every Thursday night is karaoke! It gets wild, and it’s perfect for college students looking for a fun start to their weekend!
Not a bad place
Great little locals bar. Good events in the back room. Occasionally flooded w/Greek life during the school year. Don't waste your money on the Hairy Bear!
Hairy bears are the answer
Nice fun atmosphere
Staff is great. Went to watch karaoke league and had a blast.

Waitress was great, food good, I left a very large tip. I left my to go box on the table and come back right after and hear they threw it away. I asked if they could make another one but they said I would have to pay full price for another order. I was very upset because I tipped over 30% and didn’t even really eat much of my food, and they did nothing.

Came for karaoke, the only disappointment I had with my visit was having to leave.  Food was delicious, got something simple - burger and onion rings, so good!  I will be back for sure, as often as I can!
this is the perfect place with the warmest people, to enjoy an intimate evening with songwriters and folk performers. nice drinks and  simple tasty dishes
Hairy bears before Sports is the best pregame in town
Great staff

I enjoy Bears Place. They have a unique    entertainment, a good drink selection, and menu. But they were clearly not staffed well enough for the show they presented tonight. Service was really slow, kitchen was slower.
Karaoke league was an interesting experience
A great dive
Cheap drinks, cozy tables, Mama Bears Pizza menu available! They show films and have karaoke!

Good food, steep prices. A lifesaver for music students across the street. The live music is commendable, the canned music is not. You can count on something violent being shown on one of the many intrusive televisions.
Slower service

Friday, Feb 08 2019, night: The man at the entrance asked for a second form of ID. I asked about the reason, since I have been drinking here for around 2 years but they never asked for a second ID before. The man responded in a very arrogant and provocative tone and said  “because it’s the rule!”. I questioned him of his bad attitude, which is not a good manner towards customers. Then he started to curse me and even using the F**k word against me. The worst experience ever for me!

This is a GREAT spot in Bloomington, IN!! I've gone there off and on for several years. They have delicious food at great prices, good drink specials, and I've never gotten less that good service by the servers. PLUS they host excellent singer-songwriter events and other concerts.
Excellent selection of food and great service

Bears Place used to be my ultimate place I'd start/finish my weekends out with my friends. That was before they changed their menu... The chicken strips are different now. Their honey mustard was different. Their Hairy Bears (signature drink that'll get anyone buzzed if not KO'd depending on when you go) was different. Unfortunately these changes have made me want to come here less and less over time. Every time i come now I can't even drink the hairy bears - they taste like syrups and liquor - mostly syrups. Don't let me turn you away though! They do still have some bomb food and drinks. TV's around the seating so you can watch whatever you'd like there - games, shows, news.. They have long booths that sit 6-8 people for larger groups, a smaller room with a fireplace and even a large room with a stage for karaoke you can rent out for parties and such,
Nice place for a bite.
Very nice people that work there. Friendly.
Good food. Good drinks.
Quesadillas live music, I'm down
Great karaoke! Watch out for the hairy bears
Saw a film screening in the back room. Great space for small events like that

Delightful venue for live entertainment. I had the privilege of performing in their songwriters’ showcase rotation to a great crowd alongside some of the best musicians money can’t buy. Looking forward to hitting the Monday open comedy mic later. Good selection of draft beers and excellent, friendly service.
Great staff, good prices
The food is good and the staff are nice. Good for a casual drink on weekdays, or a more lively experience Thurs—Sat.

I came for kareoke league. Happens in the back room from Feb to May on the first and third Saturdays. Really great atmosphere. Only happens in the backroom. Some of these people should be professional. Best kareoke in town
Not a big fan of bars, but the karaoke times are fun.  Food looked good though I didn't eat that night, but others were saying how tasty it was.  Clean and nice service.
Friendly service, liked watching a movie there. Was crowded so took awhile to be waited.
Good service and the Harry bear is delicious and strong!
Great drinks and good vibe!
Took over an hour for them to bring the food out, got the orders mixed up, then they closed the kitchen because they weren't able to keep up with the customers.
Good music and nice atmosphere

Oddly shaped, deceptively large restaurant/bar. Seems like a lot of history there and they host quite a variety of events. Kids welcome in the front; 21+ in the back area. Fireplace adds a very warm, comfortable feel. Great drinks, too!

Beer selection was ok but the food was not great. I don't think I've had worse chips and salsa anywhere. Stale chips and salsa that was just chunks, no liquid. I thought salsa was Spanish for sauce. This was more like a relish.
It's an ok place. Nothing special or bad, just OK
Good place to get beer and food.  Friendly service and a nice place to watch sports.
Great college bar!
Could be better, could be worse. Has a lot of upstart bands and open-mic nights.
Love kareoke on Thursdays!!!
Great place for a beer and some pub food
Very good drinks good food and open mic comedy
Great cocktails
Food was good looked clean
Good food.
Cobb salad was delicious!
Enjoyed their comedy open mic, run by a great guy!
Good food, quiet atmosphere, nice staff

First off, lemme tell you that Hairy Bears taste like pure gasoline.  Not even gasoline. It's almost as if they took all of the manageable substances out of gasoline, and then filtered that into a 24oz glass with ice . But don't get me wrong, it's the best gasoline liqueur I've ever drank in my life, and the effects it has on your brain is significantly stronger than gasoline would be. The atmosphere/vibe at Bears is literally perfect. You can be loud and obnoxious with your friends, or you can go by yourself and be chill af. It's what you want. Staff is dope, always have great service. I wish I could give it six stars. Go there.
Wonderful burgers and fun place to eat.
The service is always great.  Karaoke on Thursday is a great time and the new outdoor seating is awesome!  We stop by a couple times every time we come to town.
Love visiting Bear's every time we stay in Bloomington. Great food, drinks, atmosphere, and friendly staff. We always have a great time!
Excellent service and a focus on great food! Amazing burgers made with local farm raised grass fed beef. Certainly not the normal pub type food, great experience

Went with my family a few weeks ago and we loved it. Had great service both times. The kids had a blast playing the arcade games. Food was great and an excellent beer selection with an awesome Sunday beer special.

I have been here a few times on my last few trips to Bloomington.  The last time I had the chance to meet Dave the manager and from just a brief conversation you know he cares about Bears and their patrons deeply.  Service is always great and the beer and food selection is superb.  Will always try to stop in when in town.
Try Harry's 🍺... Nothing beats it.

I've been here a couple of times for their open-to-the-public science talks. They've got a decent selection of beers that I've enjoyed so far, and their food always looks delicious (although I have yet to order an entree myself). I did get the chips and salsa as a snack during one of the talks, and the chips were good but the salsa had an odd consistency between vegetable sizes that kind of ruined it for me.  The service is usually pretty decent, and it has a great college-pub/bar atmosphere.  Would probably recommend as a place to go with friends to hang-out/drink and eat pub food.  Probably wouldn't recommend it as a family place or a date night.
Great for college crowd!

Food was okay, but took a long time. I don't know if the server was at fault, but he needs to learn that it doesn't matter whether it's his fault it not. Apologize for the delay, and do your best to provide excellent service. Don't start making excuses and complain about not being able to work faster.
Good beer selection with decent food options. Generally draws the 21+ college crowd.
Really good buffalo chicken wrap, but a bit spicy! :)
An institution near campus for a burger and a brew with friends. I"ve always been pleased.
This place is awesome. Really good food. Good service. Hairy Bears are obviously a must
really cute! Had a lovely time
This is one of the best places to get a drink. The signature drink they serve here is too damn good and also a lot of options on snacks. Definitely a must visit place during weekends ;-)
Just went for drinks with some friends and family the other night. Our server at the bar, I believe his name was Jon, was fantastic. Very friendly. Will certainly be returning here.
Good hang out bar with good lunch special
Karaoke on Thursdays is always fun and Hairy Bears are dangerously good. Only downside is that it's kind of small and they often have to turn people away due to reaching capacity.
The bartender was the best. Great place to hang out with friends.
I've never had a hairy bear before this place, and yes, oh yes was it good. I loved it so much I might come b back just to visit for one. Filled with enough alcohol to get you started!

Great food and great management! I always think that a lot of bar food sucks and is over priced. But Bears has GREAT food! I went there for karaoke night and I had ordered food and Ill have to say it was excellent. When I went to speak to the manager about the great food, he was very quick to attend to my request and very nice.
New and improved! Come check out its old school vibe now with updated management. And beautiful servers.
Best experience ever. I love this place and their environment. I always go here with my friends and will continue to go.
They have good specials during the week and it's a cozy place to grab a bite to eat.

This is a popular music school hangout spot. They have different drink specials every day - personally I like going on Wednesdays for $1 PBR. The food is pretty good too, plus the portions are big. I'd recommend the Lil Bear Burger (it comes with fries). My only complaint is that some of the staff is quite slow (even when you're there during the day) so I wouldn't recommend coming here if you don't have a lot of time to sit and wait.
Bathroom provides a great place to sit and contemplate own life choices while waiting to go on the legendary comedy stage.

The food isnt half bad. You get what you expect to get at this type of bar. Its the creeper owner who has easy fixes, but is too busy being well, a creeper. Wait staff is always yelling too. The Hairy Bear Drink is AMAZING and definitely worth going in for. At least its a quick down and leave.

This place needs to be condemned.  It smells like rotten beer and vomit, the tables are sticky with a black film, the food is disgusting and over priced.  Some evenings it is full binge drinking of Frat boys and Sorority girls.  Lastly, they have the absolute worst service in a town know for its bad service.

I've been going to Bear's Place and the Comedy Carivan for a few years, and I've never had a bad time. The food is pretty good (especially their breakfast borrito.) I also highly recommend the strawberry daiquiri. It's great if you're with a group or if you'd just like to do something a little different for an evening.

I just wasted $10 on a terrible stand-up night at Comedy Caravan in Bear's Place. Close  to the end, I stepped on a dead (dying?) rat under my chair. It was just lying there with its eyes open, and it was about 8 inches long. The wait staff stayed away, I think they were all horrified. The MC for the night went and looked at it and then left it there. Everybody was aware of it--it basically stopped the performance for a minute--but nobody bothered to clean it up. No refund--what a surprise! We even paid for our drinks. Thank God we didn't eat there. The upside--the comics were so awful it provided a good excuse to leave early. The whole place is dumpy. Never again!

This is not the actual location.  Bears is East on the corner next to a village pantry.  This is NOT Mother Bear's, which is even further East and on the same road but with less parking.  The ceiling may leak after the rains, but nothing beats the stultifying charm of this famous college institution.  Ask any standup comedian about this place and they will tell you how much they love playing at this run down establishment. As well many well established national Jazz, Blues and Rock performers have made an appearance here. The food is pub grub, with burgers/ garden burgers, appetizers (try the Nachos), and sandwiches ( the Patty Melt, Reuben, and Spinach Melt are always great).  The drinks are on the pricey side but are mixed strong compared to other local bars.  There is an excellent range of premium beer selections, from Guiness to local Upland Wheat, as well as a few lesser known brew such as Itay's famous Peroni Lager. Regardless of the upkeep this is easily one of my favorite establishments in Bloomington- unpretentious, open, and alot of fun.
